jobs.description: Main Purpose: The team, Digital Transformation Team (DTT) brings together expertise and interests from across the organization. Our goal is to build and accelerate an enterprise-wide capability for delivering digitization solutions. What you’ll have?- Passion for new technologies, keeping your ear to the ground and staying up to date with new developments and trends to ensure we continue to be ground-breaking.- Experience in providing solution design support or ready to step up.- General experience of Digitisation technologies, such as Workflows, Process Digitalization.- Outstanding project management skills, and experience of wider Business Process Management would be the icing on the cake.What you’ll do?- Review and assess opportunities put forward from across a variety of business units- Recommend solutions that combine the best of technology solutions and Business Process Digitalization.- Help drive the value proposition and strategy of the DTT, requiring a strong vision and a demonstrable record of solving challenges. Knowledge Skills and Abilities, Key Responsibilities: Responsibilities Perform current state assessment of existing processes through interviews, time activity analyses, process observations, and surveys Working very closely with other teams within DTT i.e. Document AI and Strategic System integration teams. Development of user stories and customer journeys to identify pain points and digitization opportunities Consults with business stakeholders to develop future state product design through sketches, wireframes, user flows, mockups, and prototypes, communicating rationale for design-related decisions to senior business leadership as needed Assess business case development to estimate potential value realization from digitization opportunities Translating user testing insights and feedback into actionable solutions Architecting solutions using AWS services and microservices architectures. Work closely with the Cloud Platform team to utilise modern CI/CD methods with automated deployment . Monitoring of digital product performance and maintenance requests; evaluates products in use and tracks KPIs and metrics to determine the success of specific design decisions Plan Digital product training for end users Implement product design best practices to support user-centric, digital experiences on multiple platforms Qualifications 5+ years overall experience; professional experience re-imagining, designing, and digitizing capabilities and processes into digital products and tools (Prior experience and involvement in digital transformation preferred) Knowledge of Cloud Technologies, Solutions Development, Digital Experience, and Applications Delivery management is must. Knowledge of Web technologies (Angular, ReactJS), NodeJs, JAVA Spring boot, various AWS components e.g. Step Functions Python, Lambda etc is added advantage. Experience with design hand-off to Developers and Engineers through detailed documentation and specifications Highly collaborative with proven ability to work in and manage expectations within cross-functional, global teams Key Relationships and Department Overview: This is an excellent opportunity to help set up and launch a ground-breaking new department. The new department will have 3 teams: Document AI – focusing on using OCR and AI technology to digitise documents and extract information from them Business Process Digitalisation (BPD) – mapping repetitive business processes and developing applications/workflows for Digitalization Strategic System Integration (SSI) – focussing on creating a solid technological underpinning allowing for two-way data flow into and out of core Trafigura trading systems. This position is under BPD while expected to work very closely with DTT teams, various Business functions and other technology groups. Reporting to Delivery Lead - Business Process Digitalization. Show more Show less Seniority level Not Applicable Employment type Full-time Job function Engineering and Information Technology Industries Banking, Financial Services, and Oil and Gas

jobs.description: Direct message the job poster from TLNT Bridge Recruiting Darren Butterworth Darren Butterworth Contingency search recruiter About the Role : Our client is seeking a talented Senior Full Stack Engineer to join their growing team. You’ll play a key role in designing, building, and maintaining high-performance web and mobile applications using a modern tech stack, including Fastify, SvelteKit, React, and Node.js. This is an exciting opportunity to drive product innovation with clean, scalable, and efficient code. Responsibilities : Design, build, and maintain web applications using Fastify, SvelteKit, Vue, React, Redux, and Node.js. Develop and support mobile applications with Flutter, React Native, Swift, and Kotlin. Collaborate closely with designers, product managers, and fellow developers to deliver new features from concept to launch. Write high-quality, maintainable, and well-documented code. Conduct code reviews, mentor junior developers, and champion best practices. Debug, troubleshoot, and optimize applications for performance and scalability. Ensure technical feasibility of UI/UX designs and deliver polished user experiences. Stay current with emerging technologies and recommend tools or practices to keep the stack modern. Actively contribute to agile development practices and continuous improvement efforts. Qualifications : A degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent professional experience. Several years of experience in a Senior Software Developer or Full Stack Engineer role. Backend expertise: Fastify, Node.js, RESTful APIs, cloud platforms (preferably AWS), and database experience (MySQL, PostgreSQL, DynamoDB). Frontend skills: SvelteKit, React, Vue, Redux, HTML5, CSS3, and a strong understanding of UI/UX feasibility. Proficiency with GitHub (or similar version control systems). Strong problem-solving skills, attention to detail, and a commitment to high standards. A self-starter who thrives in both independent and team environments. Excellent communication and collaboration abilities. Bonus Points: Experience with TypeScript . Deeper knowledge of AWS or other cloud providers. Familiarity with additional JavaScript frameworks and libraries. Hands-on experience with CI/CD pipelines and DevOps practices. Show more Show less Seniority level Mid-Senior level Employment type Full-time Job function Engineering Industries Software Development

jobs.description: Job Description Posted Wednesday, April 16, 2025 at 6:00 a.m. Boardwalk provides Canadians with a quality, comfortable, home living experience. We offer rental apartments and townhouses that come in a wide breadth of shapes, sizes and sets of amenities. We operate 33,000 units across Alberta, British Columbia, Ontario, Saskatchewan, and Quebec. Calgary-based candidates only. Full-time, permanent candidates only. We are seeking a talented and experienced Senior Full Stack Software Developer to join our dynamic team. In this role, you will be responsible for developing and maintaining high-quality software solutions that meet our business needs. You will work across the full stack, from frontend to backend, ensuring seamless integration and performance. Your expertise will drive the success of our projects, as you collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver innovative and scalable software applications. Responsibilities Design your code for testability using your understanding of best practices, patterns, and principles of software development Apply your knowledge of modern techniques and concepts to design and develop applications and services for either on-prem or cloud solutions Collaborate with team members on providing modern cost-effective solutions to business needs Use your experience to analyse and offer solutions when reviewing or refactoring code Maintain and update existing systems, services and applications Participate in the testing and deployment of new systems and solutions Maintain documentation and technical specifications Actively participate in SCRUM events and SDLC Mentor other team members Participate in code reviews Develop CI/CD pipelines Experience And Educational Requirements 7+ years of proven development/systems analysis experience Technical Requirements C# / VB.Net / JavaScript ReactJs / Redux ASP.Net MVC / Web Forms Unit Testing RESTful API’s / Web API Entity Framework RDMS / SQL Server / CosmoDB SCRUM / Agile GIT Azure DevOps Distributed/Event Architecture Microsoft Azure Cloud Solutions Non-Technical Requirements Able to be on premises 3 days a week - hybrid work arrangement Continuous learner/growth mindset Quickly learns and applies new technical skills Able to communicate/contribute to design decisions and architecture Team oriented, self-motivated, collaborative Able to work with minimal supervision Excellent oral and written communication skills Boardwalk recognizes our Associates as our most valuable asset. We are proud to offer: A safe and respectful work culture that attracts, supports, develops, and recognizes high-performing and innovative team members A competitive salary that’s benchmarked to industry salary data Paid vacation time plus 6 flex days Hybrid working arrangement Health & Dental, Critical Illness, & Life Insurance Benefits Group RRSP with generous employer matching Paid Training & Development opportunities Fitness & Wellness Reimbursement Interested applicants are invited to submit a cover letter and resume. We would like to thank you in advance for your application, however, only those candidates who are being considered will be contacted. Offers of employment will be contingent on satisfactory Security Background Checks, Reference Checks, and Post-offer/Pre-employment Physical Testing where applicable. ___________________________________________________________ Ready to shape the future of our communities? Come work with us and learn where doing what you love means never working a day in your life! Deeply rooted in family spirit and humility, Boardwalk’s five core values of integrity, associates, teamwork, customer service and social responsibility are more than just words - they are a way of life. Coupled with our Golden Foundation of ‘treat others as you would like to be treated,’ ‘be good,’ ‘love community’ and ‘have fun,’ we believe in happiness and creating the most memorable experiences for both our Associates and Resident Members, continually looking for new and innovative ways to enhance and strengthen all our Boardwalk communities. We hope these values speak to you as they speak so meaningfully to us! Show more Show less Seniority level Mid-Senior level Employment type Full-time Job function Engineering and Information Technology Industries Real Estate

jobs.description: Closing Date May 22, 2025 Opportunity Note: This is a ten month fixed term opportunity Are you enthusiastic about delving into the details and uncovering valuable insights? As an analyst in Quantitative Analytics and Reporting, you will have the opportunity to assess and interpret investment risks, adding value at every step of the investment risk process. Analysts in Quantitative Analytics and Reporting share similar characteristics. They are self-starting, intellectually curious, resourceful and results focused. They possess exceptional analytical, communication, and time management skills. As relationship builders, they collaborate with diverse groups of internal and external stakeholders. Most importantly, they have a strong passion for quantitative investment risk analysis and are committed to making a real difference. Your role provides you the exposure to buy-side investment strategies among various asset classes. Leveraging your quantitative experience, you collaborate with teams of risk experts to drive changes for how AIMCo tracks, understands and manages risks. Your insights will contribute to informed decision-making and help the organization optimize risk-adjusted returns. Responsibilities Produce Risk Reports and, with the understanding of risk models, conduct in-depth risk assessments, such as Value at Risk (VaR), stress testing, factor comparison, etc. Participate in project work such as, but not limited to, development of new reports, enhancement, automation or re-constructions of existing reports and processes. Collaborate closely with client/product risk managers and other stakeholders to provide methodical support. Work with Business Technology and external vendors to bring continued improvements and innovation to risk systems and processes Take ownership of the team’s work to continuously optimize them Our Ideal Candidate Bachelor’s degree in relevant quantitative field (ex: Financial Mathematics, Statistics, Actuarial Science, Business/Finance, Economics, Computer Science); graduate degree is an asset 0-3 years of experience working in the financial industry in capacities of risk management, investment management, advanced analytics, and/or quantitative modeling. Completion of or enrollment in a professional designation (e.g., CFA, FRM, PRM) is considered an asset. Knowledge of risk management and metrics used in the investment management industry (i.e., tracking error, VAR/ETL, stress testing, etc.). Strong understanding of financial markets, financial concepts, investment strategies, investment products, and their underlying risk drivers. Advanced working knowledge in Python, SQL, Excel (VBA), and other programming tools Prior experience with data engineering, visualization and reporting through Power BI Prior developer experience with Databricks is an asset Detail-oriented with strong analytical skills and a quantitative background; able to think through complex ideas and problems while assessing multiple factors to recommend practical solutions. Demonstrates a strong commitment to AIMCo’s core values of excellence, transparency, humility, integrity, and collaboration and inspires the same in others. Success Measures: Success will be achieved through gaining a full understanding of AIMCo’s risk modeling methodology. From there, the successful team member will contribute to enhancements, increase their accountability, and contribute to the annual market risk model validation cycle Note: This position will close 11:59 pm MST May 21, 2025 Next Steps We are excited to meet you. Please submit your resume or CV to be considered for this opportunity. Applications are being reviewed on a rolling basis and we will be in touch with any questions. Final candidates will be asked to undergo a security screening, which includes a credit bureau and a criminal record investigation, the results of which must be acceptable to AIMCo. ALERT - Be on the lookout for AIMCo career opportunities advertised through third parties that request an application fee or too much information. To verify, all opportunities are posted on aimco.ca/jobs Just like our investments, our international team is stronger when we are diversified. At AIMCo, we draw upon the differences in who we are, where we come from, and the way we think to foster sophisticated solutions for Albertans. Doing business the right way means building an equitable organization inclusive of all races, genders, ages, abilities, religions, neurodiversity, identities, and lived experiences. Simply put, when you can show up as your authentic self every day, you and your team can truly thrive — all in service of our clients and their beneficiaries. Show more Show less Seniority level Entry level Employment type Full-time Job function Business Development and Sales Industries Financial Services

jobs.description: At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all. The opportunity We are seeking an Azure Cloud Engineer to join EY Canada. In this role, you will be required to offer expert advice, planning, and practical assistance to EY's clients who want to move their IT infrastructure to a cloud-based system. This individual will be part of a diverse team of innovative and talented professionals, committed to providing top-tier consulting services to our clients and must ability to manage multiple client engagements simultaneously. Your Key Responsibilities: Work with a variety of Canadian clients across different industries to understand their specific cloud computing needs and objectives. Design and implement tailored cloud infrastructure, applications, and platform solutions. Create and execute cloud implementation strategies, specific to each client. Monitor, maintain, and troubleshoot cloud-based systems, ensuring optimal performance and reliability. Train and support clients during the cloud transition process, maintaining good client relationships. Develop comprehensive backup and recovery strategies that comply with Canadian business continuity standards. Communicate complex cloud concepts, ensuring that relevant stakeholders understand the risks and benefits. Follow EY methodologies and use EY tools to deliver seamless and compelling cloud solutions. Stay current with trends and developments in cloud computing, with a particular focus on their relevance to the Canadian market. Ensure EY's quality and professional standards are maintained. Collaborate with other EY teams to create integrated solutions. To qualify for this role you must have: Bachelor’s degree in computer science, IT, Systems Engineering, or a related field. Higher degree or equivalent experience is preferred. 3-5 years of design and implementation experience as a Cloud Engineer with prior consulting experience. Designing and deploying scalable, highly available, and fault-tolerant systems majorly on Azure cloud platforms. Implementing and managing Azure cloud infrastructure and services, including compute, storage, networking, and databases. Migrating existing on-premises applications and services to the cloud. Experiences with Migrations tools such as Azure HCX and Site Recovery for efficient cloud migration processes. Design and implement robust cloud infrastructure solutions and develop and manage hub and spoke architecture on the Azure platform. Demonstrate expertise in Azure networking, including ExpressRoute, VPNs, Route tables, vNET, and vNET peering. Worked with concepts of Azure active directories, Azure functions, storage accounts, Azure Migrate, Azure HCX, and Site Recovery and apply knowledge of Azure App Service and Azure Migrate to support application deployment and migration Experience in Automation (must have) and Orchestration: Automating repetitive tasks using scripting languages (e.g., Python, Bash) and infrastructure as code (IaC) tools (e.g., Terraform, CloudFormation). Implementing orchestration solutions to manage complex workflows and dependencies across multiple cloud services. Experience in Security and Compliance and Maintenance & Optimization: Ensuring cloud environments comply with relevant security standards and regulations. Implementing and managing security measures such as firewalls, identity and access management (IAM), and encryption & conducting security audits and risk assessments. Monitoring cloud environments to ensure optimal performance and cost-efficiency & performing regular maintenance tasks, updates, and upgrades. Experience in Collaboration and Support: Collaborating with development teams to support DevOps practices and continuous integration/continuous deployment (CI/CD) pipelines. Must have excellent written and verbal communication skills in English, French language skills is a plus. Willingness to travel, as needed, to meet client needs and project commitments. Exhibits EY’s values – integrity, respect, and teaming, energy, enthusiasm, and the courage to lead. What We Offer We offer a competitive compensation package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to our business. In addition, our Total Rewards package allows you decide which benefits are right for you and which ones help you create a solid foundation for your future. Our Total Rewards package includes a comprehensive medical, prescription drug and dental coverage, a defined contribution pension plan, a great vacation policy plus firm paid days that allow you to enjoy longer long weekends throughout the year, statutory holidays and paid personal days (based on province of residence), and a range of exciting programs and benefits designed to support your physical, financial and social well-being. Plus, we offer: Support and coaching from some of the most engaging colleagues in the industry Learning opportunities to develop new skills and progress your career The freedom and flexibility to handle your role in a way that’s right for you Diversity and Inclusion at EY Diversity and inclusiveness are at the heart of who we are and how we work. We’re committed to fostering an environment where differences are valued, policies and practices are equitable, and our people feel a sense of belonging. We embrace diversity and are committed to combating systemic racism, advancing gender equity and women in leadership, advocating for the 2SLGBTQIA+ community, promoting our neuroinclusion and accessibility initiatives, and are dedicated to amplifying the voices of Indigenous peoples (First Nations, Inuit, and Métis) nationally as we strive towards reconciliation. Our diverse experiences, abilities, backgrounds, and perspectives make our people unique and help guide us. Because when people feel free to be their authentic selves at work, they bring their best and are empowered to build a better working world. If you can demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible. The Exceptional EY Experience. It’s Yours To Build. EY | Building a better working world EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets. Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate. Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today. Show more Show less Seniority level Mid-Senior level Employment type Full-time Job function Engineering and Information Technology Industries Professional Services

jobs.description: United States | Canada | Remote | Work from home Why Pythian At Pythian, we are experts in strategic database and analytics services, driving digital transformation and operational excellence. Pythian, a multinational company, was founded in 1997 and started by ensuring the reliability and performance of mission-critical databases. We quickly earned a reputation for solving tough data challenges. We were there when the industry moved from on-premises to cloud environments, and as enterprises sought more from their data, we expanded our competencies to include advanced analytics. Today, we empower organizations to embrace transformation and leverage advanced technologies, including AI, to stay competitive. We deliver innovative solutions that meet each client’s data goals and have built strong partnerships with Google Cloud, AWS, Microsoft, Oracle, SAP, and Snowflake. The powerful combination of our extensive expertise in data and cloud and our ability to keep on top of the latest bleeding edge technologies make us the perfect partner to help mid and large-sized businesses transform to stay ahead in today’s rapidly changing digital economy. Why you? Are you an experienced GCP Cloud Advisor/ Account Manager based in the US or Canada? Do you want to work remotely? Do you have strong knowledge of public cloud platforms ideally focusing on GCP? Do you have experience supporting customers in cloud operations, launch/capacity planning, product release management, technical support, escalation management and/or IT consulting? Can you lead the successful adoption of Google Cloud at Pythian’s customers, guiding them through the strategic and technical facets of their Cloud transformation journey? Do you want to help transform how our customers compete and win by helping them use their data to power their business to help them deliver better outcomes faster? If you Love Your Data™ and enjoy solving complex business and technical problems and want to Love your career then this could be the job for you! What will you be doing? Strategic Guidance: Provide expert advice to clients on cloud adoption strategies, aligning technology with business objectives ,optimization , innovation roadmaps ,driving digital transformation. Financial Modeling & ROI Analysis: Develop financial models and conduct ROI analyses to demonstrate the value and cost-effectiveness of cloud investments. Cloud Solution Expertise: Provide expert advice on cloud services (IaaS, PaaS, SaaS) from major providers (GCP), tailoring recommendations to specific client needs. Cost Optimization & Governance: Develop and implement cloud cost optimization strategies and governance frameworks to ensure efficient resource utilization and compliance. Risk Assessment & Mitigation: Identify and assess potential risks associated with client’s cloud solutions, and recommend mitigation strategies to ensure business continuity and security. Stakeholder Management: Effectively communicate cloud strategies and recommendations to diverse stakeholders, including executives, IT teams, and business users. Market Trend Analysis: Stay abreast of the latest cloud technology trends, market developments, and competitive landscape to provide informed advice. Vendor Relationship Management: Facilitate and manage relationships with cloud service providers, ensuring clients receive optimal support and service. Client Education & Training: Conduct workshops and training sessions to educate clients on cloud concepts, best practices, and the benefits of cloud adoption. Thought Leadership: Produce and present thought leadership content (white papers, presentations, blog posts) on emerging cloud technologies and best practices to client Technology Evangelism: Demonstrate deep understanding of cutting-edge cloud technologies (AI/ML, serverless, containers) and articulate their business value Client Relationship Management: Build and maintain strong client relationships, acting as a trusted advisor and ensuring client satisfaction throughout the cloud journey. Customer Support:Proactively plan and coordinate customer events and product launches, collaborating with Support, Engineering, and Site Reliability Engineering to guarantee seamless customer experiences during critical periods. Act as a liaison between customers, Support, and Engineering to expedite issue resolution and manage escalations. Practice Development:Translate customer engagement insights into repeatable best practices and resources, empowering partners to drive wider cloud adoption. What do we need from you? Cloud Platform Expertise: Deep understanding of major cloud platforms ( GCP) and their services. Business Acumen: Ability to understand business strategy, financial modeling, and ROI analysis. Strategic Thinking: Capacity to develop long-term cloud strategies that align with business goals. Technical Proficiency: Ability to translate technical concepts into business value and vice versa. Communication & Presentation Skills: Excellent verbal and written communication to effectively convey complex ideas to diverse audiences. Problem-Solving & Analytical Skills: Ability to analyze complex problems, identify root causes, and develop effective solutions. Project Management: Skills to manage cloud adoption projects, including planning, execution, and monitoring. Sales & Business Development: Ability to identify and pursue new business opportunities, and build strong client relationships. Industry Knowledge: Understanding of industry-specific cloud use cases, regulations, and trends. Change Management: Ability to guide clients through organizational and technological changes associated with cloud adoption. Data Analysis: ability to analyze data related to cloud usage, cost, and performance. Cybersecurity Awareness: Understanding of cloud security best practices and compliance requirements. Financial Literacy: ability to build business cases, and analyze the financial impact of cloud solutions. Thought Leadership: Ability to create content and present ideas that influence industry thinking. Partner Ecosystem Knowledge: Understanding of cloud partner programs and how to leverage them. Ability to freely travel (up to 25%) domestically and internationally if required. Certifications such as Google Certified Professional Cloud Architect, Google Certified Professional Data Engineer, AWS Certified Solutions Architect - Professional or AWS Certified DevOps Engineer - Professional will be a major plus! What do you get in return? Love your career: Competitive total rewards package with an annual bonus Love your development: Hone your skills or learn new ones with our substantial training allowance; participate in professional development days, attend conferences, become certified, whatever you like! Love your work/life balance: Why commute? Work remotely from your home (forever), there’s no daily travel requirement to an office! You can be located anywhere in the US or Canada, all you need is a stable internet connection. Love your workspace: We give you all the equipment you need to work from home including a laptop with your choice of OS, and an annual budget to personalise your work environment! Love your community: Blog during work hours ; take a day off and volunteer for your favorite charity. Hiring Disclaimer The successful applicant will need to fulfill the requirements necessary to obtain a background check. Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in any aspect of the selection process. Show more Show less Seniority level Mid-Senior level Employment type Full-time Job function Information Technology Industries IT Services and IT Consulting
